intro: Ouratea pallida, commonly known as the pale ouratea, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. The plant is often found in moist, shaded areas of the understory in tropical forests.
